Reviews.Title: “Nice people......”
Reviews.Author: Montanagirl55
Reviews.Content: The hotel proprieters at this motel were very pleasant and helpful, which was the best part of the stay. We stayed in a "suite" with a small kitchenette, living area, bedroom and bath. The appliances worked but had frayed cords, no dishes or flatwear in the room (as described on the website) and the linens were very old and in dire need of replacement.

Reviews.Title: “HOW DID THIS PLACE PASS INSPECTION?!....”
Reviews.Author: Jayvander
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend were looking for a cheap place to stay till the morning while we were out of town. I really wanted to stay in a nicer place but lack of money. We got our room, there were cigarette burns in the floor, not to mention the bed..... It was disgusting and the sheets were dirty. When we went to pull off the sheets THERE WAS A BUG CRAWLING AROUND IN THE SHEETS! we ran out of the room screaming. We left asap and got our money back thank god. Be aware in the parking lot there will be creepy people. Two black men tried coming to "chill" with me and my friend in our room. EW.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't.”
Reviews.Author: s0sed
Reviews.Content: The room was quite clean except bed and bathroom. But I don't want write too much, just few things you MUST know. I heard gunshots, i saw latino gangsters (they were bald with tatoos and a thick moustache), i've got a herpes (whole body) form a bedsheet and after 8 months I still have it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: inregina
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after finding it on a GPS. The rate was all right (around $80) for a large room with two queen beds. Called on a long weekend and with 10 minutes notice had a room. The fellow on the desk was very nice. Room had a fridge and microwave and with some instructions the TV worked fine. The beds were clean and so was the bathroom. Also offered a continental breakfast which we didn't use at all. Was also very quiet and the place is well built. Had free wi fi which worked fine. But there are holes in the wall from paintings, peeled wallpaper and paint, one headboard off the wall and it's a place you wouldn't want to walk without socks or shoes! The furniture was vintage 70s or 80s and well worn. Also noticed that there is no smoke detector and it has been taken off the ceiling. There is work being done with rolled up carpet in the parking lot. So in a pinch for one night it was all right and the beds and bathroon were clean. But I'd never book it again.

Reviews.Title: “EWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: anonymous_person96
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Hacienda because it was close to the SafeCo field and we had to get to a Mariner's game. We decided it was only for one night and we would leave immediately int the morning. The service was bad, with non-english speaking staff. The shower and sink did not drain and when we complained to the employees they did nothing to fix it. The carpet was dirty, there were spots on the wall where the wallpaper was ripping off and they had tried to patch it. The TV didn't work and there were creepy people hanging around the parking lot. The next day we discovered there were bedbugs in the beds, as one member of our group had gotten bitten in quite a few places. It was certainly not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “This motel is fine!”
Reviews.Author: Tina-T24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some hesitancy based on the reviews. I work for a nonprofit and needed low-cost lodging for a couple of nights on a business trip. The people that run this motel are really, really, really nice and very helpful. The room was fine. The motel is not the newest or fanciest motel in Seattle, but I don't understand what people expect when they are paying significantly less than other motels. The room had everything a person would expect in motel: air conditioning and heat, hot water, cable, a comfortable bed, comfortable furniture and closet space. It was quiet at night and I got a good night's rest. This place is great for the cost and will suit you fine if you do not expect 5 star accommodations with a 1 star price tag.â€Ž

Reviews.Title: “How did this place pass health inspections? HELP !!!”
Reviews.Author: DougB06
Reviews.Content: non english speaking staff, paint peeling from walls, no internet available, breakfast was cold cereal and old milk on a counter top, dirty carpet, very old furnishings, not a good area of town, no deadbolt or chain on door, bathroom window did not shut, spray paint peeling off bathtub. not worth more than about 10.00 per night. they have hourly rates too..go figure the illegal business must be keeping them in business. NO not a good value at all.

Reviews.Title: “RUN and don't look back!!”
Reviews.Author: foxfireb1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are gross. Rug needed to be trashed years ago as did everything else in the room. Paint was peeling off the walls and there were bare spots where it had already been peeled away (possibly the crack heads took care of it when they were tweeking). The room smelled and the bathroom was dirty. The people checking in behind us look like they had been living on the streets for quite awhile. The area is industrial and didn't feel safe. We opened the door, looked around and headed back out to find somewhere inhabitable. Thank you Hotels.Com for saving us by finding us another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Musicinsac
Reviews.Content: They did not have my reservation when I arrived despite recieving an e-mail confirmation. I had to pay for a more espensive room upon arrival. There was red splatters all over the curtains. Blood??? The bedroom has no curtains except the see-through kind. The room reeked of bleach as if something as if some massive cleaning was attempted. It is in a part of town where it's all warehouse buildings, virtually no life going on. We took the mattress to living room, next to the couch under the blood splattered curtains to sleep because there was nothing to block anyone from seeing into the room in the bedrooms. NOT a pleasant night of sleep, in fact we got little sleep worry about WHY there was red blood splatters on the curtains!The room was old, the stove and oven looked at least 40 years old. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND AT ALL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this hole!!!”
Reviews.Author: jayjay62
Reviews.Content: This place was dirty and gross. We had reservations, when we arrived, we had to wait 1 hour to get into our room. The room was very dirty, walls had "spot" paint all over that was different colors. The shower dripped. It smelled. There were homeless looking guys going into the laundry room downstairs with employees, then coming out a minute later, looked like drug deals going down. The owner/manager offered us a ride in his "limo" to the baseball game for "whatever you want to pay me". The limo was trashed with trash in the back. We took the ride and gave him $20. The ride was 2 miles and now I found out he charged my credit card $120 for the limo ride. The place is a nasty little place in the middle of a bad part of the city. The staff is sketchy and scamming me money. I don't recommend this scuzz hole to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel in seattle wa at a low rate”
Reviews.Author: A_N_A_786
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the la hacienda motel and i had a great time.Staffs are very friendly.Had a good night sleep.Wake up in the morning went to the office and had a great complementary breakfast.Motel looks great.I'll recommend this motel to any one who want to spend a few night in seattle and don't want to spend a whole lot of money.Go ahead and try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This One”
Reviews.Author: dmorse
Reviews.Content: Older unimproved motel in middle of industrial area. Staff friendly but incompetent. Paper thin walls and ceilings so hope for quiet neighbors. We had quiet for a couple of nights and got no sleep for the next two nights. Looks like they are trying to fix up the rooms, but are taking their time about it. It is pretty close to downtown area, but there are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Rattlin' Rain Gutter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for close proximity to Qwest Field for a game. It rained all night & the water must have been pouring off the roof right onto the wall mounted air conditioning unit right above the bed. It sounded like water beeing poured on a drum from 20' up. Just when I thought it couldn't possibly get any louder, it rained harder & got way louder. To top that off, once the rain let up after several hours the folks in the room above ours got going. Nice squeaky bed! Guess they couldn't sleep either. Not even my earplugs could save me! The folks running the hotel were nice enough, but the place needs a face lift in a bad way, it's in a real industrial part of town and seems to attract the wrong type of guests. Spend another $20 & get a real motel room.

Reviews.Title: “Low rent neighbors”
Reviews.Author: booradley2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August, 1999. I left after one night--- it was too noisy. A family of what sounded like drunken gypsies checked into the room next to mine at midnight and it took them an hour to shower and get bedded down for the night. Then at five a.m. some ignorant hillbilly started up his monster pickup truck right beneath my window and let it idle for thirty minutes. This is also a bad location if you don't have a car---the bus into downtown is heavily patronized by Seattle's sociopathic underclass. Three of the four times I rode it I encountered an idiot trying to stir up trouble.

HotelInfo.Name: La Hacienda Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 5414 1st Ave. S, Seattle, WA 98108
